accessible.helper: Changes the behaviour of the settings screens to make them more accessible. This will dynamically change this page, but you still need to save the settings.

stationmodel.label: Station model
stationmodel.helper: A descriptive name for your station type, this will default to the station type above if left blank. You can change this to whatever you like

loginterval.label: Log interval
loginterval.helper: Frequency of Cumulus log entries - set your station to the same

time.label: Time
time.helper: Sets the time that your new meteorological day starts

summer10am.label: DST Adjustment
summer10am.helper: When using a 9am rollover, switch to 10am when using DST

cloudbaseft.label: Cloudbase
cloudbaseft.helper: Select to show cloud base in feet, otherwise it will be in metres

helpers: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.
THESE OVERIDES ARE ONLY VALID AFTER THE UNITS CONFIGURATION ABOVE HAS BEEN SET, SAVED AND THIS PAGE RELOADED

tempdp.label: Temperature decimals
tempdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

pressdp.label: Pressure decimals
pressdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

raindp.label: Rainfall decimals
raindp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

winddp.label: Wind speed decimals
winddp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

windavgdp.label: Wind speed average decimals
windavgdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

windrundp.label: Wind run decimals
windrundp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

airqulaitydp.label: Air Quality decimals
airqulaitydp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

sunshinedp.label: Sunshine hours decimals
sunshinedp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

uvdp.label: UV Index decimals
uvdp.helper: Override the default number of decimal places

units.helper: DO NOT change units after you have chosen them for the first time!

sitename.label: Name
sitename.helper: A short name for the location

description.label: Description
description.helper: A longer description of the location

altitude.helper: Enter the altitude of your station (in the units below)

hemisphere.label: Hemisphere
hemisphere.helper: Is the station North or South of the equator?

hemisphere.label: Hemisphere
hemisphere.helper: Is the station East or West of the Prime Meridian (Greenwich)?

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

recsbegandate.label: Records Began Date
helpers: IMPORTANT: You MUST keep the date format YYYY-MM-DD.
This is the 'Date of birth' for your Cumulus install, it defaults to the first time you run the program.
You may need to alter this if for instance you import historic data in Cumulus from another source, in that case set it to the first date of your imported data.

comportname.label: Serial port name:
comportname.helper: Enter the name of the serial port to which your station is connected

disconperiod.label: Disconnect period:
disconperiod.helper: Period of time to disconnect from IP loggers to allow them to upload to WeatherLink.com. The disconnect happens once a minute. Time in seconds

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

syncstationclock.label: Clock:
syncstationclock.helper: Keep station clock in line with computer clock (Davis/Instromet only)

syncclockhour.label: Clock sync hour:
syncclockhour.helper: The hour of the day to synchronise the station clock (Davis/Instromet only)

readreceptionstats.label: Reception stats:
readreceptionstats.helper: Read Davis reception stats to provide values for corresponding web tags

setloggerinterval.label: Logger interval:
setloggerinterval.rightLabel: Set the Davis Logger interval to match Cumulus MX interval
helpers: WARNING: This will clear all data from your logger if it is invoked.
If the Davis logger interval does not match the Cumulus interval, set it to match.
Requires a restart of Cumulus MX

useloop2.label: LOOP2:
useloop2.rightLabel: Enable use of the LOOP2 data packets (UseDavisLoop2)
useloop2.helper: This should only be disabled on VP consoles or VP2 consoles using firmware versions before version 1.90

raingaugetype.label: Rain gauge type (VPrainGaugeType):
raingaugetype.helper: Default is auto, the size is then inferred from the units selected for the station

vp1minbarupdate.label: VP1 barometer:
helpers: Force older Vantage Pro and Pro2 barometer to update once a minute instead of the default 15 minutes
This is not required for the majority of stations in use today

initwaittime.label: TCP/IP Initialisation Wait Time (DavisInitWaitTime):
helpers: Time to wait after establishing a connection to an IP logger before sending commands
Time is in milliseconds

ipresponsetime.label: TCP/IP Response Delay (DavisIPResponseTime):
helpers: Time to wait after sending a command to an IP logger before trying to read the response
Time is in milliseconds

tcpport.label: TCP port:
tcpport.helper: TCP/IP port for your logger. Default is 22222

autoDiscover.label: Auto-Discovery:
helpers: Enable auto-discovery of your WLL devices IP address

If you have more than one WLL, then your IP address will not be automatically set, but Cumulus will list the device IP's in the console, and the MX diags file. You must then enter the IP address you want to use in the field below.

ipaddress.label: IP address:
helpers: You can leave this at default if you enabled Auto-Discovery, and it will be set for you.
If Auto-Discovery fails, or you have more than one WLL device, then you can enter the IP address manually.

apiStationId.label: Your device id on WeatherLink:
helpers: Enter the station id used for your device in the WeatherLink.com APIv2, OR if you do not know this, leave this field blank and Cumulus will attempt to discover it for you

If more than one station is registered to your account, then all the station ids will be listed in the console and the MX diags file. You will then have to enter the required id manually in this field

wind.label: Wind sensor Tx ID:
wind.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Wind sensor

temphum.label: Temperature/Humidity Tx ID:
temphum.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Temperature/Humidity sensor

rain.label: Rain sensor Tx ID:
rain.helper: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Rain sensor

solar.label: Solar sensor Tx ID:
solar.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your Solar sensor

uv.label: UV sensor Tx ID:
uv.helper: Optional: Select the ISS transmitter ID for your UV sensor

soilTempTx1.label: Sensor #1 Tx ID:
soilTempTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #1

soilTempIdx1.label: Sensor #1 channel:
soilTempIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra temperature sensor #1

soilTempTx2.label: Sensor #2 Tx ID:
soilTempTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #2

soilTempIdx2.label: Sensor #2 channel:
soilTempIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra temperature sensor #2

soilTempTx3.label: Sensor #3 Tx ID:
soilTempTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #3

soilTempIdx3.label: Sensor #3 channel:
soilTempIdx3.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra temperature sensor #3

soilTempTx4.label: Sensor #4 Tx ID:
soilTempTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature sensor #4

soilTempIdx4.label: Sensor #4 channel:
soilTempIdx4.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra temperature sensor #4

soilMoistTx1.label: Sensor #1 Tx ID:
soilMoistTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #1

soilMoistIdx1.label: Sensor #1 channel:
soilMoistIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra soil moisture sensor #1

soilMoistTx2.label: Sensor #2 Tx ID:
soilMoistTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #2

soilMoistIdx2.label: Sensor #2 channel:
soilMoistIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra soil moisture sensor #2

soilMoistTx3.label: Sensor #3 Tx ID:
soilMoistTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra soil moisture sensor #3

soilMoistIdx3.label: Sensor #3 channel:
soilMoistIdx3.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra soil moisture sensor #3

soilMoistTx4.label: Sensor #4 Tx ID:
soilMoistTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your soil moisture sensor #4

soilMoistIdx4.label: Sensor #4 channel:
soilMoistIdx4.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra soil moisture sensor #4

leafTx1.label: Sensor #1 Tx ID:
leafTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #1

leafIdx1.label: Sensor #1 channel:
leafIdx1.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra leaf sensor #1

leafTx2.label: Sensor #2 Tx ID:
leafTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra leaf sensor #2

leafIdx2.label: Sensor #2 channel:
leafIdx2.helper: Optional: Select the channel on the transmitter you want to use for your extra leaf sensor #2

extraTempTx1.label: Sensor #1 Tx ID:
extraTempTx1.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #1

extraHumTx1.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx1.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx2.label: Sensor #2 Tx ID:
extraTempTx2.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #2

extraHumTx2.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx2.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx3.label: Sensor #3 Tx ID:
extraTempTx3.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #3

extraHumTx3.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx3.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx4.label: Sensor #4 Tx ID:
extraTempTx4.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #4

extraHumTx4.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx4.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx5.label: Sensor #5 Tx ID:
extraTempTx5.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #5

extraHumTx5.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx5.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx6.label: Sensor #6 Tx ID:
extraTempTx6.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #6

extraHumTx6.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx6.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx7.label: Sensor #7 Tx ID:
extraTempTx7.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #7

extraHumTx7.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx7.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

extraTempTx8.label: Sensor #8 Tx ID:
extraTempTx8.helper: Optional: Select the transmitter ID for your extra temperature/humidity sensor #8

extraHumTx8.label: Humidity sensor:
extraHumTx8.helper: Is sensor #1 a combined temperature/humidity sensor?

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

raingaugetype.label: Rain gauge type (VPrainGaugeType):
helpers: Default is auto, the size will be set when Cumulus connects to your WLL
* Denotes normal Davis tipper sizes

tcpport.label: TCP port:
tcpport.helper: The UDP multicast port used by the WLL, this will normally be discovered from the WLL

helpers: By default if WLL broadcasts stop being received a DataStopped condition and alarm will be triggered
Disabling this option means a DataStopped condition will only be triggered if both broadcasts AND current data API responses stop being received

autoDiscover.label: Auto-Discovery:
helpers: Enable auto-discovery of your Ecowitt devices IP address

If you have more than one Ecowitt device, then your IP address will not be automatically set, but Cumulus will list the device IP's in the console, and the MXdiags file. You must then enter the IP address you want to use in the field below.

ipaddress.label: IP address:
helpers: You can leave this at default if you enabled Auto-Discovery, and it will be set for you.
If Auto-Discovery fails, or you have more than one Ecowitt device, then you can enter the IP address manually.

macaddress.label: MAC address (read the help below!):
helpers: Populated by Cumulus when using auto-discovery. The format is  XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX
Do not edit unless you change your Ecowitt device for a new one, then just delete this entry and the new MAC address will be added for you by auto-discovery.

deviceid.label: Device Id
deviceid.helper: Get this from the weatherflow app

tcpport.label: TCP/IP Port
tcpport.helper: TCP/IP port to listen on. Don't change unless you know what you're doing.

token.label: Security Token
token.helper: Personal Access Token from your weatherflow account. See https://weatherflow.github.io/Tempest/api/ for instructions

dayshistory.label: History Days Import
helpers: Number of days to import from the WeatherFlow website.
A large amount of historical data may take a while to import.

syncreads.label: Synchronisation:
syncreads.helper: Attempts to synchronise console reads to avoid clashing with the console writing the data

readavoid.label: Read Avoid Period:
helpers: The time span around the synchronised read to avoid reading from the console.
The default 3 seconds means do not read from 3 secs before to 3 secs after the expected write time.
Time in seconds

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

readtime.label: Request/Read Delay:
helpers: Delay after requesting a memory read before trying to read data from the USB connection
Time in milli-seconds. Default = 150ms

setlogger.label: Set Logger Interval:
setlogger.rightLabel: Set the FineOffset Logger interval to match Cumulus MX interval
helpers: If the Davis logger interval does not match the Cumulus interval, set it to match.
Experimental - Use with caution

vid.label: USB Vendor Id (VID):
vid.helper: Specify an non-standard VID. Use -1 to use the normal setting

pid.label: USB Product Id (PID):
pid.helper: Specify an non-standard PID. Use -1 to use the normal setting

interval.label: File Read Interval:
interval.helper: How often to read the EasyWeather data file in minutes. Default = 1 minute

filename.label: Filename:
filename.helper: Path and filename of the EasyWeather data file (Easyweather.dat or EasyWeatherPlus.dat)

minpressmb.label: Minimum Pressure Value:
minpressmb.helper: Pressure value below which Cumulus will ignore the value in the file. Value in hPa/mbar. Default = 900

maxpressmb.label: Maximum Pressure Value:
maxpressmb.helper: Pressure value above which Cumulus will ignore the value in the file. Value in hPa/mbar. Default = 1200

raintipdiff.label: Rain Tip Difference:
raintipdiff.helper: Number of rain bucket tips between data reads above which Cumulus will ignore the increase. Default = 30

pressoffset.label: Pressure Offset:
pressoffset.helper: Offset value to apply to the pressure value in EasyWeather data file

comportname.label: Serial port name:
comportname.helper: Enter the name of the serial port to which your station is connected

baudrate.label: Serial Baud Rate (DavisBaudRate):
baudrate.helper: Serial port speed in bps. Default = 19200

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

syncstationclock.label: Clock:
syncstationclock.helper: Keep station clock in line with computer clock (Davis/Instromet only)

syncclockhour.label: Clock sync hour:
syncclockhour.helper: The hour of the day to synchronise the station clock (Davis/Instromet only)

updatelogpointer.label: Logger pointer:
updatelogpointer.helper: Update the memory pointer to the last record after every 30 data reads

waittime.label: Command wait time:
helpers: Delay after sending a command before trying to read data from the serial port
Time in milli-seconds. Default = 500

readdelay.label: Command delay time:
helpers: Delay between sending data read commands
Time in milli-seconds. Default = 500

comportname.label: Serial port name:
comportname.helper: Enter the name of the serial port to which your station is connected

helpers: Configure your station to send data to Cumulus using the Wunderground protocol
Note: If possible use the Ecowitt protocol rather than this

In WS View configure the Custom Server to use:-
Protocol: Wunderground
Server: CMX IP Address
Path: /station/wunderground?
Station Id: 1
Key: 1
Port: 8998
Interval: 20

ecowitt.helper: If your station/gateway supports the Local API, it is recommended that you use the Local API station type rather than the HTTP protocol

setcustom.label: Enable Gateway Config:
setcustom.rightLabel: Allow Cumulus to configure your Ecowitt gateway for you
setcustom.helper: Enabling this feature automatically configures your gateway to send data to Cumulus MX

helpers: Configure your Ecowitt station, or Gateway  device to send data to Cumulus using the Ecowitt protocol

Manual Configuration: In WS View configure the Custom Server to use:-
Protocol: Ecowitt
Server: CMX IP Address
Path: /station/ecowitt
Port: 8998
Interval: 20

gwaddr.label: Ecowitt Gateway devices IP address:
gwaddr.helper: You must enter the IP address of your gateway or station so that Cumulus can configure it

localaddr.label: Local Cumulus address:
localaddr.helper: You must enter the IP address of this Cumulus instance to which the Ecowitt gateway will send the data

interval.label: Update interval (seconds):
helpers: How often the Ecowitt gateway will send data to Cumulus (4-600)

Note: If you specify a time lower than 16 seconds, you will no longer be able to save the Web Server settings in the Ecowitt App. You will have to change the interval in the app back to 16 seconds in order to save other changes. Restarting Cumulus will restore the time you have set here.

forward.label: Forwarding Destinations
forward.helper: Add the URLs of the destinations you wish to forward the Ecowitt HTTP data

primaryTHsensor.label: Primary Temp/Humidity sensor:
primaryTHsensor.helper: You can over-ride the default outdoor temperature and humidity sensor by specifying a WH31 T/H sensor channel

primaryRainSensor.label: Select Rain Sensor:
primaryRainSensor.helper: You can over-ride the default tipping bucket sensor with the piezo sensor found in the WS90

wn34chan1.label: WN34 chan 1:
wn34chan1.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan2.label: WN34 chan 2:
wn34chan2.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan3.label: WN34 chan 3:
wn34chan3.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan4.label: WN34 chan 4:
wn34chan4.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan5.label: WN34 chan 5:
wn34chan5.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan6.label: WN34 chan 6:
wn34chan6.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan7.label: WN34 chan 7:
wn34chan7.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan8.label: WN34 chan 8:
wn34chan8.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

helpers: Configure your Ambient station, or WH2600/Observer IP device to send data to Cumulus using the Ambient protocol

In the awnet app configure the Custom Server to use:-
Protocol: Ambient Weather
Server: CMX IP Address
Path: /station/ambient?
Port: 8998
nterval: 20

applicationkey.label: Application Key:
applicationkey.helper: Enter the Application Key you have created in your user profile on the ecowitt.net web site

userkey.label: API Key:
userkey.helper: Enter the API Key you have created in your user profile on the ecowitt.net web site

mac.label: Station MAC address
helpers: Enter the MAC address of your station/gateway. The format is  XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX
You can find this on your device in the Ecowitt WS View or WS View Plus app

usezerobearing.label: Zero Bearing:
usezerobearing.helper: Use zero for current bearing if speed is zero

calcwindaverage.label: Average Wind Speed:
helpers: Use the Cumulus calculated value instead of the value supplied station
If your station does not supply an average wind speed, then you must enable this option

roundwindspeeds.label: Speed rounding:
roundwindspeeds.helper: Round wind speeds to the nearest whole number

use100for98hum.label: Max humidity:
use100for98hum.helper: For stations whose humidity sensors don't go above 98% and you would like to see 100% values

calculatedewpoint.label: Dew point:
helpers: Use the Cumulus calculated value instead of the value supplied station
If your station does not supply a dew point value, then you must enable this option

calculatewindchill.label: Wind chill:
helpers: Use the Cumulus calculated value instead of the value supplied station
If your station does not supply a wind chill value, then you must enable this option

calculateet.label: Evapotranspiration:
helpers: Use a cumulus calculated value for evapotranspiration if your station does not provide this value
Note this calculation REQUIRES a solar radiation sensor to estimate any sensible values
DO NOT enable this feature if your station already supplies a value for ET - eg. Davis VP2/WLL with solar

cumuluspresstrendnames.label: Pressure names:
cumuluspresstrendnames.helper: Use Cumulus names for pressure trends instead of the stations

ignorelacrosseclock.label: LaCrosse clock:
ignorelacrosseclock.helper: Use computer clock instead of LaCrosse station clock for archive data

extrasensors.label: Extra sensors:
helpers: Display and log extra sensors, if you have any connected to your station

nosensorcheck.label: Sensor check:
nosensorcheck.helper: Make Cumulus MX run even if you do not have the minimum sensors required (temp, press, wind)

userainforisraining.label: Is Raining trigger:
helpers: Normally the 'Is Raining' value is triggered by a dedicated device - currently RG11
Primary rainfall sensor: It will also be triggered by a rainfall rate > 0, or by a bucket tip
Haptic sensor: If you have a haptic rain sensor (currently only the Ecowitt WS90 supported), then if you have a tipping bucket as your sensor, the haptic sensor can be used to trigger Is Raining
If you ONLY have a haptic sensor, then you should set this option to 'Primary rain sensor'
Note: This trigger may only be transient, the next station read may not have another bucket tip and 'Is Raining' will be cleared. Use the Is Raining alarm to latch the alarm value for a while

leafwetisrainingidx.label: Leaf wetness IsRaining sensor:
helpers: Select a leaf wetness sensor to be used as a 'Is Raining' sensor
Note: This can be used in addition to the Is raining trigger above

leafwetisrainingthrsh.label: Leaf wetness IsRaining trigger:
leafwetisrainingthrsh.helper: Set the leaf wetness value in the units used by your station to trigger 'Is Raining'

advanced.helper: Here be dragons! Only alter these settings if you understand what they do.

usespeedforavg.label: Speed for average calc:
usespeedforavg.rightLabel: Use wind speed for average calculation
usespeedforavg.helper: Use station 'speed' in calculation instead of 'latest' as latter may be a gust figure

avgbearingmins.label: Average wind bearing time:
avgbearingmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to average out wind bearings

avgspeedmins.label: Average wind speed time:
avgspeedmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to average out wind speeds

peakgustmins.label: Peak wind gust time:
peakgustmins.helper: Period of time in minutes to record the peak gust speed

maxwind.label: Maximum wind speed:
maxwind.helper: Maximum allowed wind speed in your selected units. Speeds above this will be ignored

recordtimeout.label: Record set timeout:
helpers: Set the time to elapse after which new records will be cleared automatically.
The default is 24 hours

snowdepthhour.label: Snow depth hour:
snowdepthhour.helper: The hour of the day to start measuring snow depth values. Default = midnight (0)

raindaythreshold.label: Rain day threshold:
helpers: Set the amount of rainfall required for a day to be considered a 'rainy day'
Defaults value is -1, which is interpreted as 0.2 mm or 0.01 inches for *most* stations
DO NOT set to zero, then every day would be counted as a rain day

usecumulusforecast.label: Forecast source
usecumulusforecast.helper: Use the Zambretti forecast generated by Cumulus rather than the station forecast

updatehourly.label: Forecast updates:
updatehourly.helper: If using the Cumulus forecast, update only once an hour rather than every data update (recommended)

lowpressureextreme.label: Low pressure extreme:
lowpressureextreme.helper: The low pressure extreme for your location

highpressureextreme.label: High pressure extreme:
highpressureextreme.helper: The high pressure extreme for your location

pressureunit.label: Pressure extreme units:
pressureunit.helper: The units that you have used for the pressure extremes

Solar.helper: Settings used for determining hours of sunshine - if you have a solar sensor

solarcalc.label: Solar calculation method:
solarcalc.helper: Select the algorithm to use for solar irradiation calculations

sunthreshold.label: Sun Threshold (percent):
sunthreshold.helper: The percentage of the current theoretical solar value above which the sun should be considered to be shining (default = 75%)

solarmin.label: Solar minimum (W/m2):
solarmin.helper: The minimum solar reading for the sun to be considered to be shining (default = 30W/m)

transfactorJun.label: RS Transmission factor (June):
transfactorJun.helper: The R-S transmission factor of the solar radiation through the atmosphere (0.70=smoggy - 0.91=clear, default 0.80)

transfactorDec.label: RS Transmission factor (December):
transfactorDec.helper: The R-S transmission factor of the solar radiation through the atmosphere (0.70=smoggy - 0.91=clear, default 0.80)

ytdamount.label: Year-to-date amount:
ytdamount.helper: Enter a rainfall amount to be added to the total for the year when you started using Cumulus - i.e. for the period for which you have no Cumulus data

ytdyear.label: Year to which year-to-date amount applies:
ytdyear.helper: Enter the year to apply the correct to (normally this year or last year) as a four digit number. Leave as zero to disable

rainseasonstart.label: Start of rainfall season:
rainseasonstart.helper: Select the month from which the annual total is to be calculated

starts.label: Growing season starting month:
helpers: The month you want the growing season year to start
Default: 1 (January), in Northern hemisphere / 7 (July), in Southern hemisphere

basetemp1.label: Base temperature #1:
helpers: The first series base temperature which is to be used to calculate the growing degree days
Default = 5C / 40F

basetemp2.label: Base temperature #2:
helpers: The second series base temperature which is to be used to calculate the growing degree days
Default = 10C / 50F

cap30C.label: Temperature cap:
cap30C.helper: Limits the maximum temperature used for the GDD to this value - most temperate crops will use this

starts.label: Year summation starting month:
helpers: The month you want the year summing to start
Default: 1 (January), in Northern hemisphere / 7 (July), in Southern hemisphere

basetemp1.label: Base temperature #1:
helpers: The first series base temperature which is subtracted from the annual temperature sum
Default = 5C / 40F

basetemp2.label: Base temperature #2:
helpers: The second series base temperature which is subtracted from the annual temperature sum
Default = 10C / 50F

threshold.label: Threshold temperature:
helpers: Temperature below which Cumulus will start counting chill hours. In your native units
Defaults: 7C / 45F

month.label: Chill Season Starts:
helpers: The month of the year to start the chill hours season
Default: 10 (October), in Northern hemisphere / 4 (April), in Southern hemisphere
